trans-unit.source: A function that you can use instead of console.log that doesn't have this problem is as follows:
trans-unit.target: 可以使用没有此问题的代替 console.log 的函数如下：

trans-unit.source: All of these methods are obviously very slow, so even more so than with normal console.logs, you have to strip them off after you're done debugging.
trans-unit.target: 所有这些方法显然都很慢，因此，与普通的 console.log 相比，它甚至更是如此，您必须在完成调试后将其剥离。

trans-unit.source: By calling toString, you create a representation in memory that will not be altered by following statements, which the console will read when it is ready. The console output is slightly different from passing the object directly, but it seems acceptable:
trans-unit.target: 通过调用toString,你在内存中创建了一个不会被下面的语句改变的表示,控制台在准备好后会读取它。控制台的输出与直接传递对象略有不同,但似乎是可以接受的。

trans-unit.source: For the case of objects, unfortunately, the best method appears to be to debug first with a non-WebKit browser, or to write a complicated function to clone. If you are only working with simple objects, where order of keys doesn't matter and there are no functions, you could always do:
trans-unit.target: 对于对象的情况,不幸的是,最好的方法似乎是先用非WebKit浏览器调试,或者写一个复杂的函数来克隆。如果你只处理简单的对象,其中键的顺序并不重要,也没有函数,你可以一直这样做。

trans-unit.source: From Eric's explanation, it is due to console.log() being queued up, and it prints a later value of the array (or object).
trans-unit.target: 根据Eric的解释，这是由于 console.log() 排队，并且它打印了数组（或对象）的更高值。

trans-unit.source: Have I done something wrong, or is Chrome's JavaScript console being exceptionally lazy about evaluating my array?
trans-unit.target: 是我做错了什么,还是Chrome的JavaScript控制台在评估我的数组时特别懒惰?

trans-unit.source: However, there is a simple way to avoid this in your code:
trans-unit.target: 然而,有一个简单的方法可以在你的代码中避免这种情况。

trans-unit.source: I'll start with the code:
trans-unit.target: 我先说一下代码。

trans-unit.source: Is Chrome's JavaScript console lazy about evaluating arrays
trans-unit.target: Chrome的JavaScript控制台在评估数组方面是否偷懒?

trans-unit.source: It implements only log, warn and error methods, you will have to add some more in order for it to be interchangeable with a regular console.
trans-unit.target: 它仅实现 log ， warn 和 error 方法，您将不得不添加一些其他内容，以便与常规 console 互换。

trans-unit.source: Looks like Chrome is replacing in its "pre compile" phase any instance of "s" with pointer to the actual array.
trans-unit.target: 看起来Chrome似乎在其“预编译”阶段用指向实际数组的指针替换了“ s”的任何实例。

trans-unit.source: One way around is by cloning the array, logging fresh copy instead:
trans-unit.target: 一种方法是通过克隆数组,记录新鲜的副本来代替。

trans-unit.source: Simple, right? In response to this, Firebug says:
trans-unit.target: 很简单吧?针对这一点,小火哥说。

trans-unit.source: Thanks for the comment, tec. I was able to find an existing unconfirmed Webkit bug that explains this issue: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=35801 (EDIT: now fixed!)
trans-unit.target: 感谢您的评论，技术支持。我能够找到一个现有的未确认的Webkit错误，该错误解释了此问题：https : //bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi? id =35801（编辑：现已修复！）

trans-unit.source: There appears to be some debate regarding just how much of a bug it is and whether it's fixable. It does seem like bad behavior to me. It was especially troubling to me because, in Chrome at least, it occurs when the code resides in scripts that are executed immediately (before the page is loaded), even when the console is open, whenever the page is refreshed. Calling console.log when the console is not yet active only results in a reference to the object being queued, not the output the console will contain. Therefore, the array (or any object), will not be evaluated until the console is ready. It really is a case of lazy evaluation.
trans-unit.target: 关于它到底有多大的BUG,以及是否可以修复,似乎还存在一些争论。在我看来,这确实是一种不好的行为。这对我来说尤其令人困扰,因为至少在Chrome浏览器中,当代码驻留在脚本中时,会立即执行(在页面加载之前),甚至在控制台打开时,只要页面被刷新,它就会出现。当控制台还没有活动时调用console.log只会导致引用被队列的对象,而不是控制台将包含的输出。因此,在控制台准备好之前,数组(或任何对象)都不会被评估。这真的是一个懒惰评估的案例。

trans-unit.source: There can be 5 solutions:
trans-unit.target: 可以有5种解决方案。

trans-unit.source: This has been patched in Webkit, however when using the React framework this happens for me in some circumstances, if you have such problems just use as others suggest:
trans-unit.target: 这个问题已经在Webkit中进行了修补,但是在使用React框架时,我在某些情况下会出现这样的情况,如果你有这样的问题,只需按照别人的建议使用即可。

trans-unit.source: This is already answered, but I'll drop my answer anyway. I implemented a simple console wrapper which doesn't suffer from this issue. Requires jQuery.
trans-unit.target: 这个问题已经有人回答了,但我还是放弃我的回答。我实现了一个简单的控制台封装器,它没有受到这个问题的影响。需要jQuery。

trans-unit.source: Wonderful, but Chrome's JavaScript console (7.0.517.41 beta) says:
trans-unit.target: 精彩,但Chrome的JavaScript控制台(7.0.517.41测试版)说。

trans-unit.source: You can clone an array with Array#slice:
trans-unit.target: 您可以使用 Array#slice 克隆数组：

trans-unit.source: however be warned as it does a shallow copy, so any deep nested non-primitive values will not be cloned and thus shown in their modified state in the console
trans-unit.target: 但要注意的是,由于它做的是浅层复制,所以任何深度嵌套的非基元值都不会被克隆,因此在控制台中显示为修改后的状态。

trans-unit.target: 到目前为止,最短的解决方案是使用数组或对象传播语法来获得一个要保存的值的克隆,就像在记录时一样,即
